alert.note: Alert for North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 08 at 9:59AM PST until March 10 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 25 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 80 mph. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County including I-5 and highway 89. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

area.areaDesc: North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County
